narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Continued learning of Indonesian language vocabulary, grammar, and culture.
Knowledge of Indonesian culture and language, I gained more proficiency in the Indonesian language also.
I learned more about the indonesian language and culture.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This class was a pure joy during my Yale career-- no notes!
A strength of the class was always having something to do or follow in the class. Didn't find many weaknesses.
Fun and engaging class! Assignments could be posted a bit earlier.
I thought this was a phenomenal course.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The class was entirely virtual so it was over zoom and on canvas, the class had corresponding files for each week that had the material that was relevant to our class topics.
Not much could have been done differently.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes! If you have the time in your schedule you must take Indonesian! Pak Indriyo is truly a great language teacher; he's incredibly patient and so willingly to share with students about how to improve their language skills. Plus, there are few courses on Southeast Asia at Yale and taking Indonesian is one of the few consistent ways to learn more about the region. I only wish I had started taken the language sooner. There are many fun activities Pak Indriyo has for the students and overall this class is a language-learning blast!
I would recommend it since the curriculum is very smooth and easy to follow but is also challenging.
Yes- easy and fun language class!
Yes. The teachers are amazing and it is a fascinating language.
